Plum Salad with Black Pepper and Parmesan Recipe | Bon Appétit

Instead, cut off slices, working your way from the outside to the pit.Ingredients4 servings2Tbsp. sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar1Tbsp. honey½tsp. cracked black pepper, plus more6ripe red, black, and/or green plums, some thinly sliced, some cut into wedges¼cup shaved Parmesan or Pecorino, plus more for serving2Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oilFlaky sea saltPreparationStep 1Stir vinegar, honey, and ½ tsp. pepper in a medium bowl until honey is dissolved. Add plums to dressing and toss until coated. Add ¼ cup Parmesan and gently toss again just to evenly distribute throughout salad.Step 2Transfer plum salad to a shallow bowl. Top with more Parmesan, drizzle with oil, and season with salt and more pepper.How would you rate Plum Salad with Black Pepper and Parmesan?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (6)Back to TopTriangleI used about 10 small Italian Prune plums and 3/4 of a Bosc pear. I shaved some cheap Parmesan with a potato peeler. I used 1 tbsp raw honey, 1 tbsp sherry vin and 1 tbsp red wine vin and lots of black pepper.  I thought it was good, my mom thought it was fantastic. The pear was a good touch. Next time I'd use a higher quality Parmesan and an herb - mint or basil. EllyHood River, OR10/7/2021A friend gave us a bag of freshly picked plums from her garden, so made this salad for lunch. Surprising and delicious! SusanVictoria, British Columbia9/6/2021WOWZA!  I took this to my book club without testing it first.   IT WAS A HIT!
How can something so simple to make be so delicious!   The deliciousness way out of proportion to the time it took to prepare! From now on I will be eager for plum season! 
AnonymousLynnwood, WA8/21/2019Amazing flavor combination! Super easy and great way to use a glut of CSA August plums. Don't forget the flaky salt. AnonymousBrooklyn, NY8/18/2019Made this tonight - the combination is amazing. Sweet, sour, spicy, salty. Perfect summer salad, took less than five minutes to make. AnonymousLos Angeles 8/12/2019Was pretty skeptical about the plum + zippy peppery combo, but this was a damn good refreshing summer salad!
